newsitem.title: UK: M & S buys its first shopping centre.
newsitem.headline: M & S buys its first shopping centre.

text.p: British retailer Marks and Spencer Plc said on Thursday it had bought its first shopping centre with the purchase of the Gyle Shopping Centre in Edinburgh, Scotland, for 122.15 million pounds ($206 million).

M & S, Britain's biggest clothing retailer with stores dotted throughout the UK and in many other parts of the world, said the acquisition from the City of Edinburgh Council was a one-off opportunity.
"We believe it will be a good investment for us but it does not signal any change to our property investment policy," a spokeswoman told Reuters.
M & S said that the purchase would be financed from its cash resources, but declined to reveal how much rental income it expects to generate from the Gyle centre.
The retailer already has a 78,700 square feet (7,311 sq metres) store within the centre.
